main.java

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    main.java.BoardInterface, main.java.MasterInterface, main.java.RulesInterface

    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements main.java.BoardInterface, main.java.RulesInterface, main.java.MasterInterface
    Is used to keep track of the positioning of players as well as check whether a new configuration of the board (a player move or a wall placement) is an illegal move.
    Author:
    Matthew Coupal

        public boolean isOutOfBounds(main.java.Space potentialPosition)
        Checks to see whether the space being moved to is outside the scope/range of the board.
        Specified by:
        isOutOfBounds in interface main.java.RulesInterface
        Parameters:
        potentialPosition - The position the player wants to move to.
        Returns:
        true if the space is out of bounds (one of the coordinates is less than 0 or greater than 9), and is false otherwise.

        Specified by:
        isMoveLegalDiagonal in interface main.java.RulesInterface
        Parameters:
        currentPosition - The current position of the player.
        potentialPosition - The position the player wants to move to.
        Returns:

        Specified by:
        isDoubleJumpLegal in interface main.java.RulesInterface
        Parameters:
        player - The player that wants to make the jump.
        space - The space the player wants to move to.
        Returns:
        True if the move space is exactly 2 in one direction and another player is in the direction. False otherwise.

                 main.java.Space startingSpace2,

        Specified by:
        isWallHere in interface main.java.RulesInterface
        Parameters:
        startingSpace1 - A space on one side of the wall-half being tested
        startingSpace2 - A space on the opposite of the wall-half being tested
        mode - 1 if placing wall, 0 if making move
        Returns:
        True if a wall is between the spaces; False if not.
